taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family fagaceae;genus quercus;section quercus;species sinuata;variety sinuata

bio:treatment.description: Trees, to 15(-20) m, with solitary trunks. Leaves: petiole (2-)3-5(-8) mm. Leaf blade 50-120(-140) × (20-)25-60 mm. Acorns: cup very shallowly saucer-shaped and flat abaxially and adaxially to shallowly cup-shaped with constricted bases, 2-5 mm deep × (9-)10-15(-20) mm wide, enclosing 1/4 nut or less; nut subrotund to ovoid or elliptic, 12-15(-18) × 8-12(-17) mm.
Low wet areas, hummocks, riparian and limestone bluffs and prairies

verbatim.text: Flowering spring. Low wet areas, hummocks, riparian and limestone bluffs and prairies; 0-400 m; Ala., Ark., Fla., Ga., La., Miss., N.C., S.C., Tex.

parsed.habitat: Low wet areas, hummocks, riparian and limestone bluffs and prairies;
parsed.distribution: Ala., Ark., Fla., Ga., La., Miss., N.C., S.C., Tex.
